L2_gloss: to cultivate a plot of land
brother, older brother of male, family member
sister-in-law (when persons married to two sisters)
companion, friend, regidor (assistant to mayor on council)
thigh; part of the leg above the knee
Alternative form of -ba’ or another verb suffix.
to nail, to hammer, screw, put on tightly

Forms nouns from verbs
t’iq (“to seal”) → t’iqbal (“seal”)
q’osij (“to beat”) → q’osibal (“mallet”)
tzaqik (“to fall; to drop”) → tzaqibal (“dice”)

Forms transitive verbs from intransitive verbs
jupi’k (“to lie face down”) → jupuba’ (“to place face down”)
ch’aqi’k (“to get wet”) → ch’aqaba’ (“to make wet”)
to fortify, to become strong, to become hard
This term needs a translation to English. Please help out and add a translation, then remove the text {{rfdef}}.

Forms adjectives from verbs
li’ (“to roll out dough”) → li’lik (“flat”)
oq’etaj (“to cry for something”) → oq’talik (“cried for”)
muqtajik (“to cover”) → muqtalik (“buried”)

Forms nouns from verbs
q’o’ (“to paint; to embroider”) → q’o’oj (“embroidery; adornment”)
lochij (“to sprinkle water with hands”) → loch’oj (“patch of ground reserved for garden”)
mallet, hammer, club, stick used for beating grain,
mallet, hammer, club, stick used for beating grain,

Forms causative verbs from adjectives
nuch’ (“small”) → nuch’arik (“to shrink”)
pay (“stupid”) → payirik (“to become stupid”)

Forms causative verbs from -ik verb suffix
räxarik (“to bruise”) → räxarisaj (“to make green”)
ch’aqi’k (“to get wet”) → ch’aqisaj (“to make wet”)
beyenik (“to be late”) → beyesaj (“to delay”)
light, clarity, purity, c. 1554, anonymous, Popul Vuh,
to carry hanging from hand (e.g. hawk with prey), to
